instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Turn on if i press and hold power button.
threads.message:
not liquid damage, cant see any corrosion at all under a microscope ([B]damn it[/B]). never been rework.

Using a [URL="https://www.emojibase.com/emoji/1f4af/hundredpointssymbol"]?[/URL]Real Genuine Original Apple Charger!

green light, orange light, can charge the battery[URL="https://emojipedia.org/battery/"]?[/URL].

if I press and hold the Power Button for 2-3 second, the board will power up to OSX and fan spin normal
if i press once, the fan will spin for 1 second and failed.

Yes, the board is out of the housing, without the trackpad plugged in.

ASD shows 12 sensors has failed. [IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/D6NScZu.jpg[/IMG]
    [IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/3uMjzyl.jpg[/IMG]
 







<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.39v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.38v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> 8.36v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.13v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> = 0.007 (i get 3.3v for split second if i replug the magsafe)
<SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> = 0v. (i get 3.3v for split second if i replug the magsafe)
<SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN</SIGNAL> = 0v (i get 3.3v for split second if i replug the magsafe)
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> = 0v (i get 5.1v for split second if i replug the magsafe)
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> = 0.023v (i get 3.3v for split second if i replug the magsafe)
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0.02v (i get 5.12v for split second if i replug the magsafe)
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 0v (i get 3.3v for split second if i replug the magsafe)
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 0v (i get 5.1v for split second if i replug the magsafe)

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 0.0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.421v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - 3.394

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Turn on if i press and hold power button.
threads.message: You are starting the board in SMC safe mode so all sensors will fail. Usually this problem is caused by current sense issue around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Turn on if i press and hold power button.
threads.message:
17/18 : 2.8 ohms
27/18: 20.2 ohms 

i've checked all the resistors around the iSL, they are within specs.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Turn on if i press and hold power button.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Turn on if i press and hold power button.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 31858"]Check 3V3 on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> [/QUOTE]

0.051v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>


i get 3.4v on pin1,3 on <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>


So <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> is bad or one of the 4 capacitors on the bus is leaky and pulling it down?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Turn on if i press and hold power button.
threads.message:
ok, the 4 caps are shorted to GND.

just compared with known working board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Turn on if i press and hold power button.
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5025</CAPACITOR> was the culprit. i took this one out and this cap does beeps on my fluke.

replaced with one from a donor board, now the board can power up normally.

tested all good.

thank you Duke and take care!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Turn on if i press and hold power button.
threads.message: Just for reference, AVREF is the reference voltage for the A/D converters in the SMC. This is the reason all analog sensor were reading wrong.
